actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing that a Presidential commission be established to study full implications of compliance with the Clean Air Act, as amended, and adjusting the criteria that is used in monitoring air quality.

summary.text: Directs the President to appoint an ad hoc commission to conduct a study of the effects that full compliance with the Clean Air Act by every State would have nationally on: (1) employment; (2) economics; (3) health and safety; and (4) energy supplies and demands. Prohibits, during the study and for six months thereafter, the monitoring of stationary source stack emissions by the Environmental Protection Agency on any time schedule less than an average of the previous 30 days.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing that a Presidential commission be established to study full implications of compliance with the Clean Air Act, as amended, and adjusting the criteria that is used in monitoring air quality.
